revised_title: Investigating the Nature of Radiant Heating Effects from Terrestrial Sources
tldr: The author, Baden Powell, conducts experiments to understand the nature of radiant heating effects from terrestrial sources. He discovers that heat radiated from luminous hot bodies is divided into two portions by a glass screen, one being stopped by the screen and the other passing through without raising its temperature. The author also finds that the non-transmissible portion of heat is absorbed more readily by blackened surfaces, while the transmissible portion is equally absorbed by black and white surfaces.
